logic

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • logic.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientInterface

    public class Client
extends java.util.Observable
implements ClientInterface
    This class represents the client program itself. It's initialized on the first state, WaitAuthentication. It's part of the model. Created by OmniBox on 01-11-2014.

    • Constructor Summary

      Client Constructor Client instances start on WaitAuthentication state.

    • Method Detail

      • buildClient

        public static Client buildClient(java.lang.String[] args)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Client factory method. Returns Client instance according to introduced args. $multicast$ tag on args[1] means that the factory has to return an object that the address was retrieved with a Multicast request to server.
        Parameters:
        args -
        Returns:
        the client instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • defineAuthentication

        public void defineAuthentication(java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String password)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: ClientInterface
        Define Authentication. Receives username and password for authentication purpose. If data inserted is not valid, state should remain WaitAuthentication, if its valid, then state should move to WaitRequest. Exception should be handle on interface level, because this way its more flexible to create custom interfaces.
        Specified by:
        defineAuthentication in interface ClientInterface
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • defineGetRequest

        public void defineGetRequest(OmniFile fileToGet)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: ClientInterface
        Define Get Request. Receives desired OmniFile to get. It should return state WaitAnswer if there are no errors and if your waiting for an answer from the other end. If not, then return WaitRequest. Exceptions should be handle on interface level, because this way its more flexible to create custom interfaces.
        Specified by:
        defineGetRequest in interface ClientInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
